intro: Dianthus paui, commonly known as the Sierra dianthus, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants known for their showy blooms. The plant typically grows in rocky or open habitats, such as mountain slopes and meadows. It produces small, clustered flowers that are usually pink or white in color. Dianthus paui is characterized by its compact growth habit and is often found in alpine environments.
